content: On July 7, 1990, the Atlanta Braves faced the San Francisco Giants in a memorable game that featured a standout performance from pitcher Tom Glavine. Glavine tossed a complete game, allowing just one run while striking out eight batters, leading the Braves to a 7-1 victory. This game was part of a remarkable season for Glavine, who would go on to win the National League Cy Young Award later that year, solidifying his status as one of the top pitchers in baseball.
